headline: Mark Brnovich do your job!
author: Rodney Glassman
sentences:
As grocery and gas prices continue to soar, international tensions roar to a boil, and thousands surge over our border each day, Mr. Brnovich’s refusal to act rings with even more repugnance
Americans deserve to know what happened to their ballots in 2020 before heading back to the voting booth in 2022.

A graduate of the University of Arizona College of Law, Glassman was admitted to the Arizona State Bar in 2009 and has served our country for more than thirteen years while working as a private-sector attorney.

Unfortunately for him, the citizens of Arizona do not care about Mr. Brnovich’s political career, nor his dream of being a Senator; they care about getting to the bottom of an election clouded in uncertainty.

At the behest of outraged citizens, the Arizona Senate then boldly launched their own inquiry into the election, with diminished investigative authority, to make up for the Attorney General’s neglect.
In September 2021, the Senate delivered their findings to Attorney General Brnovich; he stated that he would take all necessary legal actions supported by the evidence, yet he has done nothing.
One person in Arizona had the authority to address the reported fraud and irregularities of the 2020 election before, during, and after they occurred, Attorney General Mark Brnovich.
Following the 2020 election, the Attorney General was the sole individual with the power to audit the election in Arizona and investigate the countless irregularities that occurred.
As Arizona’s next Attorney General, I will secure our elections and incarcerate those who try to interfere with them; lethargy will no longer be an inhibitor to electoral justice.
This would not have been unprecedented, even Democrat Arizona Attorney Generals have conducted audits of elections based on circumstantial evidence in the past.
The Arizona Attorney General is refusing to do his job in a sad and misguided attempt to better serve his personal political ambitions.
Yet over half a year after the conclusion of the audit, no indictments have been handed out and the investigation remains open.
Mark Brnovich is sitting on his hands in an attempt to run out the clock while he seeks election to the United States Senate.
Mr. Brnovich could have enforced Arizona’s law requiring two forms of identification to register to vote, yet he did nothing.
In Arizona, the vote count presented had less than 10,500 votes separating President Donald Trump and candidate Joe Biden.
If Mr. Brnovich’s investigation showed insignificant evidence to bring charges, the investigation would simply be closed.
This begs the question, what has the Attorney General found and why does he once again refuse to do anything about it?
This strategic disregard for civic duty is a slap in the face to the taxpayer and to the sanctity of our democracy.
Mr. Brnovich could have compelled counties to clean their voter roles as required by state law, yet he did nothing.
Arizona, like many other key states, saw numerous irregularities and countless reports of fraud.

OPINION:
After the 2020 election, most Americans were left with more questions than answers.
• Rodney Glassman is a United States Air Force JAG Corps Reservist and private attorney.
I’m running for Attorney General to bring confidence back to our elections.
Rodney lives in Phoenix with his wife Sasha and their two daughters.
The Attorney General is failing his duty to his constituents.
Yet, Mr. Brnovich has repeatedly refused to do his job.
As an Air Force JAG prosecutor, I know about duty.
Attorney General Brnovich, do your job.
Yet, Mr. Brnovich did nothing.
